page.title: 10RELIGION _ CHIGNALS
page.content: Chignal Smealy has two churches; St. Nicholas and the United Reformed. St. Nicholas' first rector was Jordamus Baratine in 1339. There is service held every Sunday. The United Reformed Church held there first service on the 5th June 1842. The first minister was Henry Wardley. This is also the nearest place of worship for Mashbury. Today only a limited number visit Sunday School. Mashbury Church is now closed as a vicar can no longer be made available due too the low numbers.At Chignal St. James there is and old church; St Marys which has been converted into a house. The Savation Army church in Barrack road was built in 1890. The nearest Church of England church is in Good Easter. ********************
